<<<<<<< HEAD
By the King. A proclamation for preventing frauds and imbezlement in His Majesties stores, particularly in cordage and nails. England and Wales. Sovereign (1660-1685 : Charles II) Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685.
2 sheets (versos blank)
Printed by John Bill and Christopher Barker, printers to the Kings most excellent Majesty, London : 1662.
At end of text: "Given at our court at Whitehall, December the fifth, 1662, in the fourteenth year of our reign.". Steele notation: Arms 66 Nineteenth of 2) be- alter-. Reproduction of original in the British Library. Copy at reel C18:1[159] printed on one sheet.
=======
